intro: Lamyra afra, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a South African plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features slender, aromatic stems and finely divided leaves that resemble those of fennel. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a characteristic common in the carrot family. Lamyra afra is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
